description: Starts up slowly and eventually does not work at all. You have to use the browser version which does not work with the camera. I usually tell people that can we have the discussion on Google Meet instead of Teams.
Great to have teams on my personal laptop so i can stay attuned to work happenings. everything mimics teams on my windows laptop pretty closely so i think it's pretty alright.
summary: Does what i need it to

description: This barely works. In the end I had to use the web version instead, but that also suffer from the same issues!
summary: I wonder when will there be a a stable version

description:
- Always acts as a startup application even when disabled (So its annoying even when you dont need it)

- Does not detect Audio input and output reliably

- Slow and crashes after a while

- You need to sign in after a reboot.

Use the brwoser version, its faster and less frustrating to use. Despite having less features
they just copy pasted code from skype even my os detect teams as a skype. tems have no identity , mic setting will not working as prorperly .
I don't even understand why it's on linux

Time into MS Teams different with PC time. MS Teams display calendar events in wrong time, also wrong time in chats and groups.

OS: Ubuntu 22.04.1 LTS
Microsoft Teams Version 1.5.00.23861 (64-bit).

I don't know what all those bad reviews are about - it runs fine for me even on low end hardware. It lacks some of the features of the Windows version, but it's perfectly usable as a lightweight Teams client.
Slow, crashes, can't join meetings. Hopefully there will be a working version soon!
The app works, but all the features added to the other platforms do not make it to this version. For Microsoft pushing cross platform, they aren't very good at it.

A quick fix is to change wayland to org. It will work fine. For changing wayland to Xorg follow steps:
1: sudo nano /etc/gdm3/custom.conf
2:waylandEnable=false
3:save
4:restart
summary: screen sharing now working on ubuntu 22.04

description: Access control while screen sharing is not supported in Ubuntu 20.04. Also, background setting feature in video call is not available.

No microphone, no speaker, no headphone. Did a restart of computer, but didn't help. Did an uninstall then reinstall it, but it didn't help. I'm worried Microsoft intentionally makes the program low-quality so that users are tempted to run away from Linux and start using Windows?
summary: Suddenly one day, Teams doesn't work

description: Screen sharing is not working on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS, please fix it!
summary: Screen sharing is not working on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS

description: Does not recognise speakers and mic in Ubuntu 22
summary: Does not recognise speakers and mic

description:
I m using Teams on Redhat Linux "teams-1.5.00.23861-1.x86_64" Most of the time and most of the linux users see a clean white image ....

was there any fix for it.

Or shall we uninstall it and continue with web browser with Not be able to see view Screen sharing...
a total disaster tool, inconvenient, cant jump to conversation part when you try to search up a word. 5-6 emojis only. interaction with the gui feels extremely poor
summary: disaster tool, inconvenient, poor quality, lack of basic function

description: worst app, most of time gives wrong sign eventhough online
summary: most of time gives wrong sign eventhough online

description: always has problems connecting
better to open thru browser rather than as desk app
summary: better to open thru browser rather than as desk app

description: Unable to Share Scree while in a meeting.
Screen sharing is not working on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS.
summary: Screen sharing is not working on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS

description: Screen sharing is not working in ubunut 22.04
summary: Screen sharing is not working in ubunut 22.04

description:
cannot use screen share option
this update has killed the performance
Screen share not working working with Ubuntu 22.04LTS. Tried reinstalling as well.
summary: Screen share not working working with Ubuntu 22.04LTS

description: Although unofficial version was available, it's still good to see official one. Works nicely on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
summary: It's to see this app on Linux

description: work properly in Fedora (RPM)
MS Teams, just awesome. They have heard the users. For once a great Application from Microsoft. Everything is neatly organized and great call quality. Keep up the good work Microsoft.
The app just stops at random times on my Fedora 31.
Crushes all the time on Fedora 31
Works smoothly without a crash!
When I run the teams app, my fan doesn't stop. I have a feeling too many background resources are being taxed to keep it up and running. I removed it.
summary: Funtions ok, but too resource intensive

description: I have to restart it multiple times to get it to start, and sometimes it even crashes while in use
Works, but sharing screen is not working (application is crashing on my fedora 30)

As this app is in preview state I accept some issues.

Only major issue I really found was that when I want to share my screen in a meeting the app crashes and automatically restarts (Debian 10.3)

Also not all features from the Windows client seem to be available in this preview. For instance background blurring in video calls.
summary: Good for a preview, needs some work

description: The app is all right, but it starts up when I start my laptop. I don't want that!How can I make this stop?

It's nice to have a native client for Linux. It supports all the major features and runs quite smoothly.

The only issue I currently have with it, is the high CPU usage (> 50 %)
summary: Great app, performance should be improved

description: I use this daily. No issues with most functions. The only thing is using bluetooth devices. If it is not connected when Teams starts it will not be in the device list. Teams does not follow or obey the system wide settings or look for devices after startup. Even when I can 'see' the bluetooth device sometimes the audio will still fail. Have to close Teams completely and login again to try and correct this. Hardwired headsets worked fine.
summary: works pretty good except for Bluetooth audio

description: doesn't work ad

The video calls are choppier then the web app.

The audio during calls doesn't get cleaned like the web app, so my colleagues hear my typing and always hear a slight background noise (this is not present with the web app).
summary: Not as good as the web app

description: Sometimes when a chat partner do some action the screen garbles and I have to restart the computer.
Thank you microsoft! Works like a charm on Fedora

Teams is a great product on Windows and the Linux version was a major need which Microsoft finally addressed. However the app is still not as useful as the Windows version. Be ready for following issues:
Microphone problems that require restarts and might still not work
Office365 connectivity problems within the app

Hopefully Microsoft will take care of these in the short term and become the best alternative for companies, until then it's not as useful as Slack or alternatives.
summary: Great app, needs a full version

description:
App works well, but does consume more resources than what I expected it to. But that is still okay. 

My question to the devs is, when will we get new features like "blurred backgrounds" or "custom backgrounds"? I have seen these on Windows, and am surprised that there is a difference between the Windows and Linux app.
Installing this caused my sound settings to go to 'Dummy Output' and stop working. Uninstalling and using the web app solved my problem.
This app is so smooth and works like a charm
As expected MS has it lagging behind the Windows version in the features.

I've been using Teams with my school account and had no problems during the distance-learning phase over the past 2 months. It uses a bit much resources compared to other Ubuntu-Tools and not all features work as they do in the WindowsApp (Background at Telecons, new raise Hand-feature is missing in the Ubuntu_Version,...), However, the main things run stable and reliable. I'm waiting for regular Updates ;-)

Using the video conference functionality, sometimes you have to restart to get audio. There often is a hum in your earphones, even if everybody is muted.

But the really terrible stuff is the collaboration software. You are constantly bothered by notifications, but it is hard find out what they signify or if they are relevant. It is very hard to get oriented and find a certain document 

Navigation sucks.
Easy to install, thanks for the Linux support MS.

App seems to work pretty well. The only issue I have found so far is that camera support for video chat seems to be hit and miss. My camera seems to work ok when setting up devices in preferences, but when actually in a call it starts ok in the bottome right hand corner and I can see myself for about 30 seconds and then it goes black. The other party never sees any video. Everything else seems to be working.
summary: Great to see a Linux Desktop Team App

description: An excellent way to access the MS world in Centos. Saved me having to use a Windows machine during lock down. The only thing currently missing is the 9 video view.
Not always working. If works, then mic & speaker wont work. Screen sharing always Crashes( OS-fedora 32)

The application works okay and was good for a quick one time use. My main complaint is that when MS Teams is run it adds itself to the Ubuntu Autostart, which is extremely annoying and I find it intrusive. There is no setting/option to prevent Teams from being added to Autostart, which is also annoying.
FYI, it creates a file in .config/autostart/ named teams.desktop 
It's easy enough to delete that file, but still...
it has many features, nice
The Linux version does not have the same tools as the Windows version
summary: Some features lost compared to Windows version

description:
Please add background blur option of during video call
and hand raise option as well in group call

Teams keeps freezing when trying to copy-paste things into the chat (even simple stuff like a single word). 

Also have issue's when connecting a external microphone. MS teams will see the new device and allow you to switch to it, but will not use it. It mutes the microphone and doesn't allow you change its volume or mute setting. This issue doesn't exist with their competitor applications.
summary: To much issue's to be usefull. Webapp works better

description: latest updates aren't avalable
keeps autorestarting, even if I say not to do that in the menu. Also somehow lost my user account, didn't recognize my Jabra speaker and is slow to start up ...
It fast synchronize with web version, give no errors, works as expected. I had long sessions with lots people and it was working flawless. A nice surprise from Microsoft.
Microsoft teams is very intelligent
Crashes when try to share my screen

Unfortunately in this app there is no wave option like it is on windows and MacOS. Also when joining meeting by link chat button may disappear. But it great in any other way from sound output and input to any other functionality a conference application should provide.
summary: It is good in a lot of ways, but there is no wave option

description: There used to be a popup to mute & unmute on screen sharing on teams. Now its not available.
summary: Teams popup (Mainly for mute) on screen sharing is not appearing now

description:
This app cannot be used for meetings, the microphone is not getting sensed and also in between, getting the message as "the microphone is not working". 

However the mic is working with browser based apps and also other meeting apps like Zoom, FCC, so it was bad experience getting into a meeting with this app
summary: Not so good, useful only for chat

description:
Does not support screen share on Linux so fairly (deliberately?) crippled really.

 I have to use it for work as we all use MS Teams (which we thought would be a much better solution to office communication than it turned out to be). There are now so many other ways to miss communications! For screen sharing I would rather use Google Hangouts than be forced to dual boot Win 10!
summary: If you have to because others are using teams

description:
On ubuntu 19, can't use 
- blur background
- custom backgrounds
- share screen (for share screen i use an unofficial tool).
What did saw, is that i can see constant updates like: 
- raise your hand - first it didn't was avbl.
- split screens when the cameras are on - first it were avbl. only 1 screen (the person that was speaking)

The company is using it, so I'm forced to use it.
Does the trick to replace the web view. At some point, it refuses to connect to our AD (was working properly before) so I can't use it anymore... :( Using ubuntu 18.04.
hangs a lot, nothing works half of the time.
Good app, but the app never updates no blur background or custom background. Together mode is not there. Background noises there. Good but not perfect.

It's automatically stop working with ubuntu server and showed

desktop-7c2e3f61-7678-4fa0-8115-6567b449178f
Error code - max_reload_exceeded

The Linux experience is awful. It crashes when screen sharing, in calls. The audio is delayed.
I am looking forward to a stable version.
summary: Great app, but it crashes all the time

description: Been using it a few times a week in these days. Has worked flawlessly however updates and improvements are often lagging behind of those who use the windows version. But a blessing to have this app on Linux.
Automatically starts up even after removing from start up applications, web cam is turned on while teams is closed or in background.

- Wayland Support Missing (Screen Sharing only with X possible)
- Audio Problems in Fedora 33

Only issue I've had is microphone and sound not always working. Seems to be an issue if you plug in your device, or pairing bluetooth, when Teams is running. Does not work to select the device in Teams settings to solve it.

Overall, works well and next update I'll most likely be able to give it 4+ stars!

The app insists on making itself autostart. That might be normal on Windows but on GNU/Linux systems it is just bad manners.

I only use this tool to join meetings hosted by others... don't execute until I tell you!
summary: Registers itself to launch automatically on login

description: I fail at getting this sucker uninstalled. And it is a sucker because it sucks at every start-up.
Could not log in or create an account because, every time, it failed forcing me to restart it and start the process all over again.
Dont use this app, too buggy
Without hardware recognition can't be able to listen and speak.
summary: Not recognize my hardware - Important Bug

description:
Pleasantly surprised, video conferencing works well, access to and downloading files to work on is good.

However file uploads are excruciating through a mobile connection.

I use a wifi hotspot on a Mobian Debian Bullseye on a Pinephone for internet connectivity. My children use Teams for schoolwork, my youngest daughter Debian Buster on HP Proliant DL360 G7 with Nvidia GT710 graphics and 15ft of cabling. My eldest also Debian Buster on HP Proliant DL380 G6 also with Nvidia GT710 graphics connected to the TV beside the cabinet.

I can get over 5Mbps down, 2Mbps up, but have had no problems downloading 4+GB distro iso files, 1+GB distro img files, or uploading 200+MB backup files to apache webservers for restoration.

Yet I was up to 4am compressing my daughter's 60MB video to try and fail to upload it to Teams. I finally succeeded this morning after FFMPEG got it down to 4.2MB.
summary: Good, but file uploading through a mobile connection painful

description: Bad shell for a terrible solution.
Very buggy, not just for linux users. This version is missing most features other platforms have. Tray icons don't work in this version either.
Works seamlessly for Teams calls.

trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash
summary: Trash in linuxn winows is better

description:
On Debian the latest Versions don't allow to join as a guest. The bug is known to the developers since four month or so, and still it has not been fixed.
Anybody having the same problem: Using an older version fixes the bug (teams_1.3.00.25560_amd64.deb works for me).

Although older versions work, I rate this 1 star, because the bug just keeps beeing ignored and makes the application completely useless for a lot of users.

You can not join meeting without logging in. Use older version 1.3 where it works.
https://packages.microsoft.com/yumrepos/ms-teams/
Nice app... get the work done ...no problems so far
My org requires PIV authentication to log into microsoft web apps. I get redirected within the site to my org's sign-in page, and it fails because it doesn't detect my card or the reader
Unmaintained app.
summary: just doesn't work if you try to use personal account

description: IS 10 times slower then the windows app
There are no features for blurring videos, the app keeps on crashing, sometimes you don't hear the other person saying anything. And the worst is that it treats Linux users as second class citizens.
summary: Updates and Performance are not up to the mark

description: Not working to me, I'm using online browser teams.
As I try to change my user, it keeps buggin and comming back to the later user. I have MS Teams
Regular issues with not being able to share things like desktop, tabs, apps. Whereas Chrome may have less features, but is more reliable.
summary: It works in a pinch, but better in Chrome

description:
For updates of .rpm package, please do something similar to VS-Code. 

So if there is a bug-fix-update, we can simply update it through terminal so that user don't have to revisit the website once in a while to see if there is any updates.
summary: Still buggy in my Fedora use-case. Hope it get's better in future

description:
Tells me to create an account, I do, tells me I already have an account if I want to login, I do, tells me if I want to log out, I say I do not, ask me if I want to create and account or login, I login, it askme if I want to log out. 

So I just use Google Meet.
this app keeps on quitting fully when clicked the teams icon
worst electron app i have seen, it bearly works.
summary: worst electron app i have seen

description: Microsoft trying to sell us some Electron App as Native Linux Application...
summary: Some simple Electron App, it SUCKS on Linux

description: leider werden nicht immer alle Aktivitäten, Team-Mitglieder etc. korrekt angezeigt. Mal funktioniert alles, mal funktioniert es eher weniger. Eigentlich aber eine gute Idee so eine Team-Plattform..

Leider gibt es zwei Apps. (Diese und das NON Preview)
Bei dieser, bekomme ich unter Ubuntu 18.04 die Lautstärke bei ALLEN Output-Interfaces nicht höher als 0.0. --> Ergo ich höre nichts.

Bin auf Teams Preview gestossen als ich in der Corona-Zeit für meine Kinder die Rechner aufgesetzt hatte. Installiert und echt positiv überrascht.
Funktioniert tadellos. Audio-/Videotel., Chats und sonstige Funktionen, alles ohne Probleme. Und das alles auf alter Hardware (und ohne Probleme!! :-) )
Vielen Dank an die Entwickler
summary: Super dass es Team für Linux gibt

description: jedes Mal andere Anmeldeformalitäten. Funktioniert an einem Tag, am nächsten erscheint nur das Icon im Panel. An einem Tag funktionieren Links über Firefox, am nächsten nur in Chrome. Videostreaming friert regelmäßig ein, bei Neuanmeldung bleibt man draußen, weil der Vortragende nicht checkt, dass man "vor der Tür steht". Kurzum nur mit Metabolit zu beschreiben

Klasse Software - Microsoft auf Linux, wer hätte das gedacht. Leider verfügt die Preview nicht über die neuen Features, v.a. "Hand heben" wäre für eine vollqualifizierte Teilnahme an Konferenzen hilfreich. Sonst ist man als Linux User nur wieder halb ausgeschlossen... schade. Wann kommen diese Features? Selbst ne Neuinstallation hat sie nicht mitgebracht :-(
Oberfläche schlecht gestaltet... nicht alles wird korrekt angezeigt... ...aber gute Idee. Discord ist viel besser...
Man kommt nicht rein. Egal wie oft man sein Kennwort eingibt. Nicht zu empfehlen!!
Actually it is imposible to log in or join a session. In the actual state the application is absolutely useles.
zwingt zum Anmelden
Das Programm zwingt zum anmelden/registrieren. Tut man dies funktioniert es trotzdem nicht. Zudem hat das Programm die Frechheit sich nachd em Login automatisch zu starten.

I have used calendar and meetings for some weeks. They are running without problems on 20.04, 18.04. and I could not find resonable functional difference to the Windows app. One star misssing because I do not like autostart by default, but that can be turned off in settings.
Läuft bis zur Registrierung für Teams, dann passiert nichts mehr, Anwendung steht. Wenn es kein Preview wäre, hätte ich gesagt: typisch Microsoft...

Verlangt ein Konto bei Microsoft, verlangt eine Registrierung bei Teams, Verlangt die Installation von Skype und funktioniert trotzdem nicht.
Allerdings wird Anschließend beim Hochfahren jedesmal der Anmeldebilschirm von Microsoft Aufgerufen. Bei Deinstallation von dem Müll verbleiben trotzdem irgendwelche Funktionsfähigen Reste auf dem Rechner.
Bis auf das man kein Hintergrundbild setzen kann funktioniert alles , wie unter der Windows Version.
summary: Funktioniert bis auf ein Sache sehr gut

description: Wechsel zwischen Tenants nicht möglich, Wechsel zwischen Usern grausam.. eigentlich nicht verwendbar...
Der Titel sagt alles
summary: Benötigt Account obwohl man einen Gastlink hat

description: Ich finde es schade, dass es sehr lange dauert, bis Features, die es bei der Windows-Version gibt, in der Linux-Version veröffentlicht werden.
summary: Nicht wie in Windows, aber funktioniert

description: Teams läuft sehr flüssig, aber viele funktionen sind leider nicht benutzbar!
Nach Anmeldung soll man sich noch einmal anmelden/registrieren .... dead lock

summary: linux users are second-class citizens for microsoft

description:
Es funktioniert wie unter Windows. Man kann einzig den Hintergrund nicht ändern, aber das geht bei mir auch mit der Windows Version nicht.
Ich kann den Bildschirm teilen, chatten, sprechen usw.

So soll das sein !
Installation sinnlos
Es funktioniert zwar, aber Updates kommen sehr verspätet oder garnicht. So fehlen sehr viele der Features und allgemein wirkt diese Version auch sonst einfach nur lieblos hin geklatscht.
Nach Installation springt das Programm jedesmal beim Rechner- Hochfahren von selber an (Autostart). Deaktivieren lässt sich das nicht.

Das Progamm lässt sich nicht verwenden. Es öffnet im Endeffekt nur ein Fenster im Broweser mit dem man sich dann Anmelden soll.
Teams schein auf Linux derzeit nur mit einem Edge (nicht getestet) oder Chrome Browser verwenden. 
Tipp: Verwenden Sin ur den Chrome Browser und nicht diese App.

When trying to share my screen, i could only share legacy Xorg windows.
Sharing thw whole screen results in only the mouse cursor beeing visible.
Also teams doesn't feature any settings regarding bluring of camera background.
summary: screen share only shows mouse cursor. won't blur camera background

description: Kann mich nicht anmelden.

Es macht was es soll! Und für alle: JA es kann sehr wohl in den Einstellungen so eingestellt werden, dass es nicht beim Systemstart mitladet! Einfach auf das Icon in der Leiste klicken und entsprechend einstellen! Getestet bei Xubuntu 20.04 und Xubuntu 21.04 wie auch bei Linux Mint 20.x !

Nach Installationen Regristiert man sich normal mit seinen Konto. Bis dahin funktioniert auch noch alles, aber dann möchte Teams das man sich regristriert, obwohl ich schon ein Teams Konto habe, dass auch auf anderen Geräten funktioniert. Ich habe mich trotzdem versucht zu regristieren, aber am Ende wird man wieder auf das Programm zurück geleitet, wo steht das man sich regristieren soll. Ich hoffe das, dass Problem schnell gefixt wird, da es ja kein einzelfall ist, wenn man durch die Rezenssionen guckt und Teams vorallem in der jetzigen Zei mit Covid-19 sehr wichtig ist.
cannot login, only in usable in chrome.

Um meine Konfiguration (Mikrofon, Kamera) zu testen, habe ich leider den Test-Anruf verwendet. Dieser lässt sich bei mir nur nicht mehr beenden. Hierfür muss ich das Programm komplett schließen beenden, was für eine super Arbeit seitens Microsoft spricht.
Außerdem wird das Programm jedes mal neu gestartet, wenn man den Workspace wechselt, ist das unter Windows auch so?!

Leider nistet sich Teams im Austostart ein. Dann wird bei jedem Neustart ein Erste Schritte Popup angezeigt. In 50% der Fälle ist Ubuntu dann komplett unbedienbar. Selbst Konsolen sind nicht mehr erreichbar. Nach einigem Hin und Her habe ich es jetzt deinstalliert.

Estuve en clases, funciona bien, pero no he podido compartir pantalla con mis compañeros de clase. Es una enorme carencia. Y el menu flotante roba espacio en la pantalla, deberia ubicarse en otro lado.
Permite acceder a la aplicación sin tener que usar el navegador. Todo un acierto.
It crashes when I start sharing my display (on Centos8 SO)

Quizás falte una forma fácil de cambiar de usuario.
El resto funciona como la otra, sin más problema.
La quinta estrella si mejora la interface.

muy buena aplicación, área de mejora cuando uno cambia a otra ventana por ejemplo el correo y ves un archivo adjunto no aparece el icono de regresar, pero todo esta perfecto para teams, hasta un curso me dieron utilizando esta aplicación

Tengo una latitude E7440 Intel Core I5 de 2.0 gb, 12 gb memoria RAM. Con W10 se quedo tildada. Instale Ubunto 19.01 y solucione todos mis problemas de velocidad, puedo hacer videoconferencia compartiendo pantalla y video a la vez sin ningun parpadeo o lentitud. Estoy Usando Prospect Mail para el Outlook 365, excelente tambien.
Funciona cuando quiere, a veces abre sin problemas, otras veces nisiquiera se ejecuta.
Chash when i try share my window

It can improve I It could be better.
I can talk without problems but the crashes when I share the desktop
summary: Crash when I share my desktop in centos 8

description: NO es posible compartir audio aún y la funcionalidad de dividir grupos aún no está disponible para ubuntu, mientras que para windows si lo hace.
Ha funcionado muy bien hasta ahora, no he tenido bugs o algún problema similar, de todas formas si llegase a tener un, actualizaré la opinión
summary: No la he probado a fondo, como estudiante, me ha ido bastante bien

description:
A parte de que la aplicación no funciona demasiado bien en general, no se puede compartir contenido ni pantalla (en Debian10).
Es muy confusa y no se complementa bien con los enlaces de acceso a reuniones.
summary: Compartir contenido no funciona en Debian10

description: No funciona casi nunca
No permite activar el audio, no deja realizar eventos en vivo
En RHEL 8.3 no permite compartir la pantalla, el audio se cuelga, le falta mucho para mejorar, el zoom funciona bastante mejor e incluso el teams version web en chrome funciona mucho mejor.
Al estar aun en desarrollo no trae las mínimas funciones que hay por ejemplo en windows o android. Espero que no pase igual que con Skype en linux
esta mejor que la app que tienen en windost
Me ayudo mucho en la escuela, obviamente hay algunas cosas que se deben mejorar tanto en optimización como en otros pequeños detalles, fuera de eso me sirvio bastante gracias!

En Ubuntu la aplicación funciona bastante mal, tiene cantidad grande de detalles y problemas. Algunos son: Al compartir pantalla no permite elegir una ventana, sino todo lo que uno está viendo. Al compartir una imagen en un chat, muchas veces se muestra un recuadro sin la imagen. No es posible minimizar al mínimo la ventana cuando uno comparte pantalla. Aparecen errores de funcionamiento al compartir pantalla. No suelo hacer reseñas, pero esta aplicación está tan mal que me pareció bien tomarme el tiempo para ver si en algún momento la mejoran.

En Ubuntu la aplicación funciona bastante mal, tiene cantidad grande de detalles y problemas. Algunos son: Al compartir pantalla no permite elegir una ventana, sino todo lo que uno está viendo. Al compartir una imagen en un chat, muchas veces se muestra un recuadro sin la imagen. No es posible minimizar al mínimo la ventana cuando uno comparte pantalla. Aparecen errores de funcionamiento al compartir pantalla. No suelo hacer reseñas, pero esta aplicación está tan mal que me pareció bien tomarme el tiempo para ver si en algún momento la mejoran.
Me gustaría tuviera mas funcionalidades como la versión de Windows
NO SE PUEDE INICIAR SESION
No permite activar el audio del sistema al compartir pantalla

He visto la evolucion del desarrollo de esta aplicacion en Linux, con el tiempo en lugar de mejorarla, le ha ido quitando cosas como compartir el audio del sistema, ver 6 o mas personas en la llamada, incluso la aplicacion de navegador ha sufrido de esto pero mas grave, ahi solo te permite ver a una sola persona a la vez, todo esto mientras otras aplicaciones como zoom y meets funcionan sin ninguno de estos inconvenientes, si alguien que lea esto puede evitarla, que lo haga, crei que con el tiempo mejoraria pero fue a peor, adoptar, extender y erradicar.
summary: La peor app de video conferencia para Linux

description:
Mi cuenta pertenece a dos organizaciones y este cliente no me permite cambiar entre ellas. Inicia sesión en la principal y al intentar cambiar, entra en la secundaria un segundo y automáticamente sale y reentra en la principal. En el cliente web no tengo problemas para hacer el cambio.

Mientras no se corrija esto, para mí es inusable.
Se reinicia constantemente tras el login, te muestra la info durante unos segundos y se reinicia.
tras que es lenta joder no permite compartir el audio del sistema
No permite cambiar de equipo
En OCACIONES no permite adjuntar archivos, se tilda la llamada y tarda en actualizar los mensajes.
No me dejaba entrar a un equipo al cual habia sido invitado.
funciona al 100
Pues lo he instalado y me salia no se que de la uni de madrid jaja
funciona correctamente
La app me funciona correctamente pero cada que reinicio mi dispositivo tengo que volver a iniciar sesion y eso es muy molesto
summary: Funciona bien, pero hay un problema

description: como es una version preview, pide tener cuenta profesional. No funciona con mi correo.

description: Demande de créer un compte microsoft même lorsque on clique sur un lien d'invitation à une reunion, sous windows le même lien ne demande pas de créer de compte.
summary: Demande de créer un compte microsoft

description: Passez votre chemin tant que l'application ne sera pas dans une version stable. Utilisez l'application web qui fonctionne parfaitement.
summary: Crash, ne detecte pas les appels, ne detecte pas le micro, etc

description: Application ne fonctionnant qu'avec 50 % des fonctionnalités de base (très génant quand on doit faire une présentation avec un ppt). Sinon, le logiciel fonctionne corectement dans la globalitée.
summary: Application ne fonctionnant qu'avec 50 % des fonctionnalités de base

description: c trop lente comme application et ça bug bcp
Bug ... vous envoie sur une impasse... à éviter absolument !

L'appli Buggue et fait bugger Ubuntu:
- messages d'erreur régulier d'erreur logicielle lorsque TEams n'est meme pas lancé (cette erreur disparait apres une désinstallation)
- parfois Ubuntu 'gèle' , l'écran est figé , toutes les touches deviennent inactives pendant une session Teams
- La connexion initiale, est tout un poème entre les comptes Microsoft et les comptes personnels on s'y perd...et Teams s'y perd. IL demande parfois une double authentification.
Le partage d'écran est pratique et fonctionne bien
summary: ergonomie tres discutables et bugs frequents

description: Inutile, besoin d'un compte Windows de m**** pour pouvoir lancer l'appli. L'intérêt d'être sur Linux n'est-il pas justement d'éviter ce genre de désagrément ? En gros, ne sert à rien...
Impossible de participer à une réunion sans créer de compte. Ce n'est dit nulle-part.

- Beaucoup moins riche que celle sous Windows

- Ne capte pas toujours le son du micro, c'est aléatoire, il faut relancer l'ordinateur et ça peut fonctionner ou pas ...
Nulle, multiples essais sans succès! on me conseille d'installer d'utiliser Skype... depuis plusieurs années sur mon ordinateur.
summary: confirme que j'ai bien fait de quitter Windows pour Linux!

description:
tentative pour un usage pro, assez instable. des problèmes récurrents avec le son. Le partage d'écran se fige. 
Ergonomie décevante.
Je veux supprimé Teams de mon ordi sous Linux mais je n'y arrive pas . Y a t-il un moyen de le suprimé definitivement.
Plante souvent, lent.
dans un terminal c/c  sudo apt purge teams

C'est une insulte de ne pas offrir à la communauté Linux les mêmes fonctions que les Windows. 

On a eu certaines d'entre elles comme les flous d'arrière plan mais ca a été retiré pour cause de plantage. J'ai des nouvelles pour vous Microsoft : ca plante pas moins souvent!

C'est à se demander comment comme Microsoft peut prendre toute une communauté pour des imbéciles.

L'envoi de fichier ne fonctionne pas.
Le partage d'écran ne fonctionne pas avec Wayland, mais fonctionne avec X11.
Testé avec Ubuntu 21.10
gêne l'ouverture d'autres applis
В целом неплохо, но часть функций в сравнении с версией для Windows не доступны
summary: Не работает функция показа рабочего стала. Когда исправите?

description: I couldn't connect to the conference as a guest

При попытке входа пишет, что "кто-то уже настроил Тимс для вашей организации. Обратитесь к администратору или войдите под другим е-мейлом". Примерно так. Настроил, естественно, я. С чем мне обратиться к самому себе -- я не знаю. Удалил.

сильно грузит систему, по дефолту автозапуск 
точно не для линуксоидов
право работать в нем гораздо лучше чем в нынешнем зуме
Установилось,не могу никак избавится от него, при запуске системы запускается по дефолту, в системе значится как удаленое, но все равно при старте ОС запускается.
Ужасно, не возможно использовать
Я СЧИТАЮ MICROSOFT ДОСТОЙНОЙ СИСТЕМОЙ ДЛЯ РАБОТЫ И ЧТО ЛИНУКСУ ЭТО НЕ КОНКУРЕННТ НО ДРУГ.
иы меня не застваишь перейти на тове говно
Жодного разу не вийшло просто залогінитись, завжди доводиться відновлювати пароль, а потім дивитись на повідомлення про те, що такий пароль вже існує.

Что-то передает с диска в интернет.
Я не верю, что приложение настолько кривое (как и сам Микрософт), что так ужасно грузит систему.
